column4: anyone know of a command to see all devices/computers connected to the network?
how do I find the IP address of my printer (connected via network)?
print a test page if it's on a network printer
by pressing the button on the print server
the printer hasn't been installed yet, that's why I need the IP address...and the printer has a built in print-server
try printing a tst page those usually give the ip of them
ok, I'll give it a go.
I just get an "Error while printing" message
well did you walk over to the printer, or are you trying to do it though ubuntu?
Through ubuntu...there isn't a test-page setting on the printer though AFAIK
there is a test page button try turning off the printer then press down the power button for 3 seconds then let go it might print a test page
no luck, didn't print a test page
what were you looking for on it, I'll see if I can find it
trying to figure out how to use a test page on it without using a computer
I'll see if I can find the printer manual somewhere
